sentences.english: Their hands blistered . but no one complained.
sentences.chinese: 他们手起了泡，可是没有一个人有怨言。

sentences.english: The servant accepted his dismissal without any complaint.
sentences.chinese: 那仆人毫无怨言地接受解雇。

sentences.english: But no half other complaints, fir to accept criticism.
sentences.chinese: 但杉木并无半句怨言，虚心接受批评。

sentences.english: Although lampoon, but everybody have no complaint.
sentences.chinese: 虽疲于奔命，但大家都毫无怨言。

sentences.english: Wherefore doth a living man complain, a man for the punishment of his sins?
sentences.chinese: 活人因自己的罪受罚，为何发怨言呢？

sentences.english: They grumbled in their tents and did not obey the Lord .
sentences.chinese: 在自己帐棚内发怨言，不听耶和华的声音。

sentences.english: Spend your time counting your blessings, not airing your complaints.
sentences.chinese: 花时间数算恩典，而不要口出怨言。

sentences.english: The employees were asked to detail their complains and grievances.
sentences.chinese: 要求雇员们逐一说明他们的怨言和苦情。

sentences.english: The husband begins to have complaint, think replant fruiter.
sentences.chinese: 丈夫开始有怨言，想改种果树。

sentences.english: If not, well, I accept the physical penalty without complaint.
sentences.chinese: 就当是毫无怨言地在承受这个肉体上的罚款。

sentences.english: The March wind is fretful, fretting the languid waves into murmurs.
sentences.chinese: 三月风躁动不安，把倦怠的波浪搅得满腹怨言。

sentences.english: The Japanese quietly and uncomplainingly take the stairs to their offices.
sentences.chinese: 日本人安静地，毫无怨言得爬楼梯到办公室。

sentences.english: She deeply hated Father Madeleine, but made no complaint.
sentences.chinese: 她恨透了马德兰伯伯，但是不出怨言。

sentences.english: Under the pressure of hunger, the Children of Israel again began to complain.
sentences.chinese: 以色列人在旷野行走，苦无食物，于是又开始发怨言。

sentences.english: I will go without a murmur, And His footsteps follow still.
sentences.chinese: 无论何往，不出怨言，随主脚踪一路行。

sentences.english: She never mentioned any grudge and really respected him.
sentences.chinese: 对他没有半句怨言，真的很尊敬他。

definition: making an all-out effort (idiom); to try one's heart out/to do one's utmost
to feel guilty/to feel ashamed of oneself/to be remorseful
to complain/to grumble/to harbor a complaint/to feel dissatisfied
to resent/to harbor a grudge against/to loathe/resentment/rancor
frigid irony and scorching satire (idiom); to mock and ridicule
